title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 563.3 - Vehicular and pedestrian traffic
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 563.3 - Vehicular and pedestrian traffic

State Regulations
(a) The Vehicle and Traffic Law of the State
of New York applies upon the premises under the jurisdiction of the
college. (b) No person shall drive
a vehicle on college streets, roads or highways at a speed greater than is
reasonable and prudent under the conditions and having regard to actual and
potential hazards then existing, but in no event shall a person drive a vehicle
in excess of 20 miles per hour unless a different speed is authorized and
indicated by the college. (c) Unless authorized, no person shall park a vehicle on college premises in such
manner as to interfere with the use of a fire hydrant, handicapped parking
zone, fire access lane or other emergency zone, or create any other hazard or
interfere with the free and proper use of a roadway or pedestrian
way. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
563.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
